resources.string: QR Code
Aztec
Data Matrix
PDF417
Code 39
Code 93
Code 128
EAN-8
EAN-13
ITF
UPC-A
UPC-E
Codabar
2D square format used worldwide. Default.
2D format alternative to QR Code. Its center pattern resembles an Aztec pyramid - hence the name.
2D square format that can encode data in a very small surface area.
2D linear barcode, used by United States Postal Service (USPS), among others.
1D barcode, not used worldwide, ancestor of the more popular Code 128.
More compact than Code 39. Used by Canada Post.
1D barcode used worldwide in shipping and packaging (particularly, its GS1–128 subset).
1D barcode used in small packages for which EAN-13 is too large.
Also referred as International Article Number. It\'s a 12 or 13 digit barcode used for identifying products globally. Also used for encoding ISSN and ISBN.
AKA Interleave 2 to 5, and also ITF-14. Less used when compared with EAN or UPC.

AKA Universal Product Code. 1D barcode format used worldwide for tracking products in stores and supermarkets. 12 or 13 digits, including a 0 prepended automatically by the app (to comply with standard)
Alternative to UPC-A, designed for small items where 12 digits do not fit.
1D barcode, used often in libraries, but not popular in current times.
Something\'s wrong. If the issue persists, contact the developer.
Input error. Data Matrix supports ISO/IEC 8859–1 characters. It does not support non-latin alphabets, nor does it support emojis.
Input error. Code 39 can have up to 80 characters (currently at %d), and only supports ASCII (letters, numbers, and some special characters).
Input error. Code 93 can have up to 80 characters (currently at %d), and only capital letters, numbers, and some special characters.
Input error. Code 128 can have up to 80 characters (currently at %d), and only supports ASCII (letters, numbers, and some special characters).
Input error. EAN-8 can either have 7 digits (currently at %d), or 8 with the last one being a checksum.
Input error. EAN-13 can either have 12 digits (currently at %d), or 13 with the last one being a checksum.
Input error. ITF must have an even number of digits, up to 80 (currently at %d).
Input error. UPC-A can either have 11 digits including the 0 prepended automatically by the app (currently at %d), or 12 with the last one being a checksum.
Input error. UPC-E\'s first digit must be 0 or 1. It can either have 7 digits (currently at %d), or 8 with the last one being a checksum.
Input error. CODABAR only have numbers.
